attributes.action: reduce both fuel duty and VAT on fuel duty to a combined maximum figure of 42p per litre.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Fuel duty and VAT on fuel currently cost every driver around 70p per litre, which is the highest level of tax in Europe. In a country that produces 80% of it's oil needs, and has one of the best fuel delivery infrastructures in the world, combined with one of the worst public transport systems (except for London), this is disgraceful. Manchester roads are currently half empty because drivers can't afford to fill up. Food prices are rising, partly due to rising fuel costs. What will the Government tax when the oil runs out - breathing?
